row.subject: Peerless Proposal as discussed on Thursday, May 17, 2001
row.content:
M1.1. Paul / Dan:
[Conventional: salutation]
M1.2. Can you give me your opinion as to the structure of this deal, based on your experience?
[Request-Information: opinion as to deal structure based on experience]
Flink1.2

row.subject: Peerless Proposal as discussed on Thursday, May 17, 2001
row.content:
M2.1. Jaime,
[Conventional: salutation]
M2.2. Seems like this could be a good deal for Eco.
[Inform: could be a good deal for Eco]
Blink1.2
M2.3. The pricing seems reasonable to me given the fact that Peerless will have money tied up on inventory that we will seldom use.
[Inform: pricing seems reasonable]
M2.4. Questions:
[Inform: the following are some questions Dan has]
M2.5. 1. what is the going rate for leasing tank capacity in the area?
[Request-Information: going rate for leasing tank capacity in the area]
Flink2.5
M2.6. 2. will Peerless be storing No.2 (that meets our quality specs) in tanks in addition to Eco's?
[Request-Information: will Peerless be storing oil that meets Enron's quality specs in tanks as well as Eco's]
Flink2.6
M2.7. Do they plan to transfer diesel back and forth between those tanks?
[Request-Information: will diesel be transfered back and forth between tanks]
Flink2.7
M2.8. If so, how do we control quality?
[Request-Information: if so how do they control quality]
Flink2.8
M2.9. 3. how much Minimum Inventory will Peerless agree to?
[Request-Information: how much Minimum Inventory will Peerless agree to]
Flink2.9
M2.10. The more the better for Eco.
[Inform: the more Minimum Inventory, the better, for Eco]
M2.11. Note: The Platt's Index is Low Sulfur No.2 U.S. Gulf Coast - Waterborne
[Inform: Platt's Index type of oil]
M2.12. Dan
[Conventional: signature]
M2.13. - comments?
[Request-Information: any comments]
Flink2.13

row.subject: Peerless Proposal as discussed on Thursday, May 17, 2001
row.content:
M3.1. I would like for us to take a look at charging Peerless some sort of number based on the market price for leased storage.
[Inform: Dan would like to charge Peerless some amount]
M3.2. I talked to a guy in the Enron liquids group who said that 2-oil tankage in the Caribbean goes for about $0.25- $0.30 per barrel per month.
[Inform: monthly per barrel price of 2-oil tankage in the Caribbean]
M3.3. If we leased them only 150,000 bbls of capacity in the tank and kept the rest for ourselves, that would be around $40,000/month.
[Inform: monthly charge if Peerless is leased 150,000 bbls of capacity in the tank]
M3.4. The actual number could be whatever we are comfortable with keeping in storage as minimums.
[Inform: actual number whatever Enron is comfortable keeping in storage as minimum]
M3.5. If we could get something out of it every month and still sell them our inventory that would be great.
[Inform: would be great if they could make a monthly profit and still sell Peerless their inventory]
M3.6. But I would also like to know how it looks in case they wouldn't go for that and we had to hold title to whatever oil we already have in the tank.
M3.7. Then we could still have some sort of pricing mechanism for buying and selling oil to each other in the tank.
[Inform: if Peerless does not agree to this, Enron should still have a pricing mechanism for buying/selling oil to each other in the tank]
M3.8. From what I heard from Peerless, they would plan to unload vessels into Eco's tank,
M3.9. then transfer out of that tank to their other tanks when needed.
[Inform: from what Dan heard, Peerless plans to unload vessels into Eco's tank and transfer out to other tanks when needed]
M3.10. Whatever the case would be, we would have to have controls on quality in our tank,
M3.11. and insist on seeing the analysis on everything before it goes into the tank.
[Inform: Enron would have to have quality controls/insist on seeing analysis of anything that goes into tank]
